admissions.question: What are the admission requirements for undergraduate programs?
admissions.answer: The admission requirements for undergraduate programs at Federal University Wukari include: 1. Five O'Level credits including Mathematics and English, 2. UTME score of at least 180, 3. Post-UTME screening exercise, 4. Relevant subject combinations for your chosen course.

admissions.question: How do I apply for admission?
admissions.answer: To apply for admission: 1. Visit JAMB portal to choose Federal University Wukari as your first choice, 2. Participate in UTME, 3. Check university website for post-UTME screening details, 4. Complete online application on the university portal.

courses.question: What courses are offered at Federal University Wukari?
courses.answer: Federal University Wukari offers various courses including: Agriculture, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Computer Science, Economics, English, History, Mathematics, Physics, and more. Visit the university website for the complete list.

registration.question: When is course registration for new students?
registration.answer: Course registration for new students typically begins 2-3 weeks after resumption. Specific dates are announced by the registry department and communicated to students via their portals and notice boards.

facilities.question: What facilities are available on campus?
facilities.answer: The university campus features: modern lecture halls, well-equipped laboratories, library, ICT center, hostels, sports facilities, medical center, and student union building.
